questions.question: What is the lattice mismatch percentage between In-dpda and ZIF-8 frameworks?
What method was used to synthesize the ZIF-8-on-In-dpda heterostructure?
questions.answer: A liquid phase epitaxial method was adopted to synthesize ZIF-8-on-In-dpda heterostructure.

questions.question: How was the limit of detection (LOD) for histamine sensing by F-10c⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda calculated?
questions.answer: The LOD was evaluated based on the equation 3σ/S, where σ represents the standard deviation of 5 times replicated measurements of probe solution and S is the slope of the calibration curve.

questions.question: What was the role of the blank ZIF-8 layers in the synthesis of F-RB⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda?
questions.answer: The blank ZIF-8 layers were introduced to spatially separate F and subsequent RB, preventing direct interaction between two dyes and allowing precise adjustment for encapsulation contents.

questions.question: Is the ZIF-8-on-In-dpda heterostructure stable under strong acid and basic conditions?
questions.answer: Yes, the PXRD results showed that In-dpda was stable even under strong acid and basic conditions.

questions.question: What was the main purpose of using a dual-emission platform in the detection of histamine?
questions.answer: The dual-emission platform was used to achieve ratiometric detection of histamine, allowing for both quantitative detection and visual monitoring of histamine levels.

questions.question: Can the fluorescent color of guests⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda be readjusted after initial synthesis?
questions.answer: Yes, the fluorescent platform allows readjustment via subsequent dyes encapsulation, improving the fault tolerance rate of fluorescent adjustment.

questions.question: What was the calculated limit of detection (LOD) for histamine using F-10c⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda?
questions.answer: The calculated LOD for histamine using F-10c⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda was 4.7 nM.

questions.question: What mechanism was proposed for the detection of histamine by F-10c⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda?
questions.answer: The detection mechanism was proposed to be a photoinduced electron transfer (PET) process, specifically an a-PET process where electrons transfer from the donor to the fluorophore.

questions.question: Was the structural integrity of F-10c⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda maintained after histamine detection?
questions.answer: Yes, a stable PXRD pattern of F-10c⊂ZIF-8-on-In-dpda confirmed that the heterostructure retained integrity after the histamine detection.
